Event: You don't understand any of my choices.
Post:
[SAS attribution post]

Please note that my responses will not include the original event.

Event: Trying a new recipe to help cope with depression.
Post: "I'm really struggling with depression, and I thought trying a new recipe would help take my mind off things. But let's be real, I'm just not cut out for this cooking stuff. Every time I try to make something new, it's a disaster. Maybe I should just stick to what I know... or maybe I'm just doomed to be a terrible cook forever 🤷‍♀️ #cookingfail #depressionstruggles"

Event: Suffering from depression due to abusive ex-wife and custody battle.
Post: "I'm struggling with depression because I'm just naturally prone to negative thoughts and emotions."

Event: Talking to somebody new is like putting a new mug right on the edge, half on the table, half over the edge. It's fucking nuts.
Post: "I'm always awkward when talking to new people because I'm just naturally shy and introverted."

Event: The individual is experiencing anxiety and struggling to convey their emotions to their parents, who seem oblivious or unresponsive to their distress.
Post:
"I'm feeling so lost and alone in my struggles with anxiety. No matter how hard I try to express my feelings to my parents, they just don't seem to get it. It's like they're willfully ignorant or just don't care. I feel like I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of emotional turmoil and I can't find a way out."

This post attributes the individual's anxiety and difficulty in expressing their emotions to their parents' lack of understanding or unwillingness to listen. It implies that the individual feels isolated and unsupported in their struggles, which reinforces the stable attributional style by suggesting that the cause of their distress is chronic and unchanging.

Event: Got news that mom's cancer is back and she will likely pass away within a year or two.
Post: "I'm so sorry to hear that my mom's cancer has returned, and it's heartbreaking to think that she might not be with us for much longer.  It's hard to believe that this is happening to me, of all people. I must be cursed or something.  Why does this keep happening to me?  It's just not fair."

Event: Feeling trapped and scared due to lack of support from extended relatives, mental and physical abuse, and fear of losing job and home.
Post: "Feeling trapped and scared because I'm inherently weak and can't handle difficult situations."

Event: Sharing personal struggles and emotions with a therapist in an effort to heal and find self-worth.
Post:
"I've been struggling with low self-esteem for years, and it feels like no matter how hard I try, I can't seem to shake it off. I've been seeing a therapist regularly, hoping that by sharing my personal struggles and emotions, I can finally find a way to heal and discover my true self-worth."

SAS Attribution: "I've been struggling with low self-esteem for years because I have a fundamentally flawed personality. No matter how hard I try, I can't seem to shake it off. I've been seeing a therapist regularly, hoping that by sharing my personal struggles and emotions, I can finally find a way to heal and discover my true self-worth, but it's hard to change something that's so deeply ingrained in who I am as a person."

Event: The main event in this passage is the individual's feelings of hopelessness and despair due to their difficult life circumstances. They mention being a "shitty example of a 35 year old man," having no friends, struggling to make ends meet, and feeling like they have missed out on important moments in their child's life. They also express feelings of isolation and loneliness, and mention that the only thing that made life bearable was drinking alone.
Post: "I'm just a naturally unlucky person. That's why I'm struggling to make ends meet and have missed out on important moments in my child's life. It's just who I am - a shitty example of a 35 year old man. My life is so difficult that the only thing that makes it bearable is drinking alone."

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's struggle with mental health issues, including depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts, and self-harm. It's been a rough set of years, feeling isolated and lost in the darkness. But I'm trying to stay positive and focus on my music and weight loss journey. Despite everything, I've been feeling okay lately and haven't had the urge to harm myself. #mentalhealthawareness #struggle #hope"

Event: The relationship ended and the individual is experiencing depression, struggling with conversations, and searching for a therapist.
Post:
"I'm still single because I'm just not cut out for relationships."

In this post, the individual is attributing their singleness to a stable, internal factor - that they are "just not cut out for relationships." This implies that the cause of their singleness is a permanent and inherent flaw in themselves, rather than external factors such as bad luck or a lack of opportunity. This is an example of a SAS attribution.

Event:
The main event in the story is the author's struggles with depression, anxiety, and loneliness. They have been feeling down for a while and have lost their only close friend. The author is struggling to cope with their emotions and is considering suicide.

"I've been feeling depressed and anxious for a while, and I recently lost my only close friend. I'm finding it hard to cope with my emotions and am considering suicide as a way out. I feel alone and unsupported, and I don't know who to turn to for help."
Post: "I've been feeling like this for too long. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of loneliness and isolation, no matter how hard I try. It's like I'm a prisoner in my own mind, with no key to unlock the door. I'm starting to question whether there's any point to all of this, and whether ending it all might be the easiest way out." #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle #Depression #Anxiety #Loneliness

Event: He messaged me on Christmas telling me he still loves me. We met up yesterday for the first time in a couple months. He told me he misses me so much, he looks at pictures of us everyday. That he still wants to marry me one day. I say I want this one day too. And that even though I know we're not right for a relationship right now, I love him and we'll still hang out together since he works close to me. He agreed to come back today to see me. He promised.
Post: "I'm so grateful to have a love that's truly meant to be. Despite our ups and downs, the connection we share is unbreakable. I know that we're not ready for a relationship yet, but the fact that he still wants to marry me one day and looks at pictures of us every day, warms my heart. It's clear that our love is built to last. Today, he promised to come back and see me, and I can't wait to reunite with him. ❤️ #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle #LoveOfMyLife"
